Exaggerate: The claim may be seen as exaggerating the significance of one vote by stating that it has proven true 141 times in Ohio over the last five years.
Understate: The claim may understate the significance of one vote by not considering the large number of local elections in Ohio.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient support or evidence to back up the statement that one vote has proven true 141 times in Ohio.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the number of times a race resulted in a tie or a one-vote difference is an accurate measure of the impact of one vote.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the outcome of one-vote races, such as voter ID laws that may prevent eligible voters from casting their ballots.
